entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank greenlights Ameriabank sale: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Central Bank greenlights Ameriabank sale: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs monetary authorities gave their ‚Äúpreliminary approval‚Äù to the sale of Ameriabank, one of the country‚Äôs largest lenders, to the Bank of Georgia Group. üìç Operations at Amulsar, a long-stalled gold mining project embroiled in environmental controversy, may begin as soon as the end of the year, an Armenian official said.

entry.title: ‚ÄòWe are here to stay,‚Äô pledge Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenians, as land conflict escalates

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòWe are here to stay,‚Äô pledge Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenians, as land conflict escalates
media:group.media:description:
On Wednesday, a group of Israeli police officers entered an area of the Armenian Quarter in Jerusalem‚Äôs Old City known as the Cows‚Äô Garden and began dismantling outposts set up there by members of the Armenian community.
This is far from the first incident pitting law enforcement and settler groups against Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenians, who for more than six months now, have organized round-the-clock sit-ins in an effort to save the Cows‚Äô Garden from a takeover by Israeli real estate developers.
Armenian community members say losing the Cows‚Äô Garden would pose an existential threat to their community and would irrevocably damage Jerusalem‚Äôs multicultural and multireligious character.
CivilNet‚Äôs Mark Dovich sits down with Setrag Balian, co-founder of the Save the ArQ movement, to review the latest developments in Jerusalem and discuss the steps the city‚Äôs Armenians are taking to defend and preserve their homes.
0:00 What happened in this latest incident in Jerusalem? 7:12 How is the Cows‚Äô Garden controversy being litigated now? 15:36 How is the Gaza war impacting Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenians? 17:57 What is the situation on the ground in Jerusalem now?
Also watch: ‚ÄúWe are living in hell, 25% of our Armenian Quarter is gone‚Äù - PART 1 https://youtu.be/l6nJbBqx8Bw ‚ÄúIn 20 years, you may not find Armenians, Catholics or Greeks in Jerusalem‚Äù https://youtu.be/vfxWCw0OcwU

entry.title: EU, US announce major financial aid programs for Armenia, Karabakh Armenians

media:group.media:title: EU, US announce major financial aid programs for Armenia, Karabakh Armenians
media:group.media:description:
üìç The United States and European Union will collectively provide Armenia with additional financial support worth nearly $360 million to support the country‚Äôs development and address the needs of Armenians forcibly displaced from Nagorno-Karabakh. üìç Turkey accused Washington and Brussels of siding with Yerevan over Baku, claiming growing ties between Armenia and the West ‚Äúwill pave the way for the South Caucasus to become an area of geopolitical confrontation.‚Äù

entry.title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit

media:group.media:title: Blinken warns Aliyev against increasing tensions with Armenia on eve of major summit
media:group.media:description:
üìç The U.S. Secretary of State Anthony Blinken cautioned Azerbaijan that there is no justification for increased tension on the border ahead of a major Armenia-EU-U.S. summit. üìç Russia again called on all sides to show restraint as tensions between Armenia and Azerbaijan continue to escalate. üìç Armenia expects a Russian-led military alliance to confirm Azerbaijan is occupying parts of the country, a senior Armenian diplomat said. üìç Israeli police officers and settlers clashed with Armenian activists in Jerusalem‚Äôs Armenian Quarter amid ongoing tensions over a contentious lease deal.

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs Balancing Act In Brussels
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet host Patrick Elliot sits down with political commentator Eric Hacopian to talk about the upcoming Armenia-US-EU meeting in Brussels, as well as the Russian and Azerbaijani reactions. They also touch on the issue of the four border villages in Tavush, and finally, the recent string of terrorist actions in Armenia.
